Summary: Maryana returns to Camelot alive—but survival has a cost. Her escape from captivity leaves the court shaken, the king fearful, and the city bristling with suspicion. Old alliances strain under the weight of secrets, and the laws against magic tighten even as something ancient stirs beyond the castle walls. Hidden within Camelot is a boy the world was never meant to find. His presence bends fate in subtle, dangerous ways—drawing attention from forces that do not yet understand what they have awakened. As Arthur is pulled between loyalty and justice, and Morgana begins to walk a darker, more deliberate path, Maryana is forced to confront a truth she has spent years avoiding: destiny cannot be outrun—only challenged. entry.summary:
Author: moralssun

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,751Chapters: 2/10Kudos: 14

Summary: Arthur thought this must be some strange, subconscious interpretation of his worry over Merlin’s disappearance translated into a dream in his restless sleep. If it didn’t feel so real, he may have pinched himself. After several seconds of silence, he choked out a lone sentence. “You think that’s,” he gestured to the undeniably beautiful maiden in their company, “Merlin?”  -- In which Merlin gets kidnapped and turned into a girl by an unknown sorcerer plaguing Camelot, and assumes a fake identity while touring the Kingdom with King Arthur. Gwen knows, Gaius knows, the knights know, Arthur knows, and absolutely no one else can find out. Arthur finds himself more and more enchanted (figuratively speaking) with this "new" Merlin, but when the spell wears off, and Arthur realizes that the original Merlin looks just as, if not more beautiful than he did as a girl, and his affections did not just disappear upon seeing Merlin returned to a man, he's forced to confront feelings he hadn't realized he had been suppressing. Merlin is really bad at taking the hints.
